author: Kathy Reakes
title: Police Department In Hudson Valley Expresses Thanks For Support During 'Darkest Time'
text:
"During our darkest time, our community, law enforcement brotherhood, and local fire departments banded together and shined the light to guide our grieving members through the most challenging loss our agency has suffered," said the town of East Fishkill Police Department Acting Chief Lt. Derrick Cuccia in a letter to all.
The incident happened around 6 p.m., Monday, Dec. 18 on the Taconic State Parkway in East Fishkill.
East Fishkill Police Department officer Daniel P. DiDato, age 47, was traveling to Westchester Medical Center in Valhalla to continue an investigation with an accident victim when his vehicle ran off the road and hit a tree.
He was transported to MidHudson Regional Hospital in Poughkeepsie where he died from his injuries.
During DiDato's funeral, Cuccia said: "To see so many flag-waving members of our community lining the streets and saluting the funeral procession in a show of support reminds us how privileged we are to serve and that Sgt. Daniel DiDato did not die in vain.
"For 19 years, Sgt. DiDato proudly and faithfully served this community without hesitation and in return, our community came out to ensure his service was honored."
He also thanked all who turned out to support DiDato's family while paying their final respects.
"To the law enforcement brotherhood, Thank You. The countless letters, phone calls, and emails expressing concern, support, and encouragement proved to our department members they are not alone," he added. "The assistance we received with planning and coordinating events allowed our members time to grieve."
The love and support the countless law enforcement agencies and PBAs have shown to our community has been an emotional lift to our members and the friends and family of Sgt. DiDato, the acting chief said.
Cuccia said while the police departments are too numerous to list, I would be remiss if I didn't mention those within our immediate community who responded in our hour of need:
- New York State Police
- Dutchess County Sheriff's Office
- City of Poughkeepsie
- Town of Poughkeepsie
- Dutchess County Emergency Response
- Town of Fishkill
- Village of Fishkill
- Village of Wappingers
- Hyde Park
- NYPD
- Department of Environmental Protection
- Westchester County Police
- Putnam County Sheriff's Office
- The City of Beacon.
"Thank you to the East Fishkill and surrounding fire departments for the spectacular flag displays along the funeral procession route," Cuccia said. "We are all in this together and your contribution and show of support will never be forgotten."

and receive free news updates.

author: Jacky
title: DR MICHAEL MOSLEY: What I do to help stop aging and stay healthy‚Ä¶ From flossing twice a day to keeping my house at a cool 15 cents, how to reduce ‚Äòinflammation‚Äô
text:
Haven‚Äôt you made your New Year‚Äôs resolutions yet? Then you might consider doing something about your ‚Äúinflammation.‚Äù
The term, a portmanteau of inflammation and age, is generating growing interest among scientists as more and more research suggests that chronic inflammation is a major driver of aging and many of the diseases that accompany it.
While we all have some inflammation somewhere, and increasingly so as we age, keeping levels as low as possible will pay multiple dividends. Reducing it can slow down your biological clock, allowing you to live a longer, healthier life, with a reduced risk of heart disease, diabetes, arthritis and dementia.
I am fascinated by inflammation, so much so that I recently interviewed Janet Lord, director of the Institute of Inflammation and Aging at the University of Birmingham. During the interview, which airs next Friday on Radio 4, she offered me her advice for reducing inflammation, which I share below, along with others that I practice myself.
As long as you‚Äôre not frail, sick, or elderly, it may be worth lowering the thermostat a couple of degrees.
SET AN ALARM TO MOVE
One of the best ways to reduce inflammation is to sit less (perhaps set an alarm to remind you to get up and walk at least once an hour) and become more active.
A study conducted by the University of California in 2017 found that a single session of moderately fast walking was enough to make a difference.
The researchers took blood from 47 volunteers before and after walking briskly on a treadmill for 20 minutes.
This was enough to significantly reduce levels of a pro-inflammatory chemical called TNF (tumor necrosis factor), which plays an important role in immune defenses but can also trigger chronic inflammation.
FOLLOW A ‚ÄòMENTAL‚Äô DIET
The Mediterranean diet, rich in oily fish, nuts, olive oil, fruits, vegetables and legumes, is famous for its anti-inflammatory effect.
Because? Many of the benefits seem to come from the impact it has on our gut bacteria.
In a study published in the journal Gut in 2020, researchers asked more than 600 people (ages 65 and older) to follow their normal diet or try a Mediterranean-style diet.
Regular tooth brushing and flossing reduces the chance of developing gingivitis, inflammation of the gums, caused by plaque buildup between the teeth.
A year later, people who had changed their diet not only showed signs of better brain function, such as better memory, but they also had many more ‚Äúgood‚Äù bacteria in their intestines, the kind that produce anti-inflammatory chemicals called bacteria. Of short duration. chain fatty acids, which have been linked to a reduced risk of cancer and heart disease.
Another more recent study, published in the journal Neurology last year, found that people who follow the so-called MIND diet (which is like the Mediterranean diet, but with greater emphasis on eating berries and leafy green vegetables, such as spinach and kale ) had brains that were considered to be 12 years younger than those who did not.
We don‚Äôt know exactly why, but it may be that components of the MIND diet (such as omega-3 fatty acids, antioxidants, and polyphenols) reduce inflammation in the brain. So add another serving of vegetables to your meals and some berries to your yogurt.
LOWER THERMOSTAT
Over the past few months (with the reluctant cooperation of my wife Clare), I have kept the thermostats in our house at a fairly cool 15¬∞C.
Not only does this save money, but there is evidence that keeping the room temperature low causes the body to produce more brown fat. Unlike regular fat, brown fat burns a lot of calories (to keep you warm) and produces a chemical called maresin-2 that helps reduce chronic inflammation.
There is evidence that keeping the room temperature low causes the body to produce more brown fat. Unlike normal fat, brown fat burns a lot of calories
As long as you‚Äôre not frail, sick, or elderly, it may be worth lowering the thermostat a couple of degrees.
USE THREAD TWICE A DAY
Regular tooth brushing and flossing reduces the chance of developing gingivitis, inflammation of the gums, caused by plaque buildup between the teeth, which not only increases the chances of losing teeth, but is also related to chronic inflammation elsewhere.
This is because bacteria from plaque can travel in the bloodstream to other parts of the body, including the brain.
A study conducted by the University of Birmingham in 2021 found that having advanced gum disease increased the risk of developing mental illness by 37 percent, heart disease by 18 percent, and type 2 diabetes by 26 percent.
Researchers are working on several options to combat gingivitis and therefore chronic inflammation, including the use of oral microbe transplants.
The idea, which is currently being pursued by researchers in Australia, is to load a mouthguard with healthy insects that enter the mouth and then fight off the acid producers currently colonizing the teeth.
There‚Äôs still a long way to go, but in the meantime, if you don‚Äôt floss, start now.
And floss first, then brush: Flossing dislodges plaque, which brushing then sweeps away.
LIMIT MEAL TIMES
Cutting calories leads to a longer, healthier life (or so studies show) and one of the ways to achieve this is by reducing chronic inflammation.
That was the conclusion of an American study published in the journal Aging in 2016. For this study, 220 brave volunteers were randomly assigned to continue as normal or reduce their daily calorie intake by 25 percent for two years.
This is a big task and not everyone who was asked to reduce their calories (some, but not all, were overweight) managed to stick to such a draconian diet. Those who did so saw a large reduction in inflammatory markers, such as TNF (mentioned above).
The good news is that researchers don‚Äôt think it‚Äôs necessary to go that far to see benefits; It is enough to reduce your daily calorie intake by 10 to 15 percent, which for the average person could mean cutting out 200 to 300 calories (i.e. a small bar of chocolate).
Or you may prefer to follow an intermittent fasting diet, such as the 5:2 diet (where you reduce calories two days a week) or schedule-restricted eating, where you eat within a period of time.
A recent study shows that intermittent fasting reduces levels of pro-inflammatory cells called monocytes in the blood.
BREATHE STRESS
Short periods of stress are manageable, but chronic stress causes high levels of inflammation.
Some of the best ways to reduce chronic stress include being more active and eating a healthy diet, but I also recommend practicing slow, deep breathing, which slows your heart rate and makes you feel calmer.
There are many different ways to do this, but my usual breathing exercise is 4:2:4. I breathe in through my nose for a count of four, hold my breath for a count of two, and then breathe out through my mouth for a count of four.
A couple of minutes is enough to reduce my stress levels and fall asleep, if I am awake in the middle of the night.
Dreamer? It‚Äôs good for your brain.
Since I was little I have been a true dreamer. I can be on the couch, getting ready to empty the bins, which I promised to do, when my mind wanders and I start thinking about something completely different.
As you can imagine, this irritates my wife. Fortunately, I can now point to research that shows that, far from being a waste of time, daydreaming can be good for my mental health.
This is based on a recent study, published in the journal Nature, conducted by researchers at Harvard Medical School in the US. They showed a group of mice black and white images, while monitoring brain activity. The mice were then left alone for some downtime. While that was happening, parts of his brain occasionally lit up in distinctive patterns, as if he were mentally reviewing those black and white images.
At the same time, there was increased activity in the hippocampus, the part of the brain responsible for storing memories. If the same is true for humans, then this suggests that when we seemingly do nothing and daydream, our brains are actually still working hard, strengthening new neural connections and existing memories.
And that, in turn, suggests that it‚Äôs important for our brain health to make room in our day for more dreams. So she puts her feet up, she puts the phone aside and starts staring into space. Who knows what great ideas your brain will come up with?
One of the strange things I noticed when I went to the sales recently to buy new shoes is that my feet seem to have gone up half a size.
Apparently this is common.
As you age, your feet may widen because, as you age, the ligaments and tendons that support your arches lose some of their elasticity, so your foot may spread. This is partly a product of wear and tear (by the time you reach my age you‚Äôll probably have taken around 190 million steps) and partly because any weight gain in middle age increases the downward pressure on your feet.
If you have foot pain or if your shoes are more worn on one side than the other, then it could be a sign that you need arch support and it may be time to invest in some insoles.

author: MarketScreener
title: Volkswagen Workers to Begin Striking Monday, Union Says - MarketScreener
text:
By Mauro Orru and Dominic Chopping
Volkswagen employees will begin striking next week as union leaders and the German auto giant failed to agree on how to cut costs amid a slow electric-vehicle market and fierce competition, a union official said Friday.
A spokesperson for the IG Metall union said workers would begin warning strikes on Monday, which will see their members down tools for a few hours a day. The duration of the strike will depend on how further negotiations progress, the spokesperson said.
Volkswagen employs around 300,000 workers in Germany and operates 10 plants in the country and the industrial action set to begin Monday relates to around 120,000 employees at plants in Wolfsburg, Braunschweig, Hanover, Salzgitter, Emden and Kassel and some subsidiaries.
A contractual obligation that prevented a strike is due to expire on Nov. 30. The latest round of talks between Volkswagen and the union ended without an agreement and negotiations are set to resume on Dec. 9.
Volkswagen didn't immediately respond to a request for comment.
Volkswagen has been at loggerheads with the IG Metall union for weeks as it seeks to implement sweeping cost cuts across its domestic business in a move to become more competitive.
Write to Mauro Orru at mauro.orru@wsj.com and Dominic Chopping at dominic.chopping@wsj.com
(END) Dow Jones Newswires
11-29-24 0601ET
Share ¬© Dow Jones - 2024

author: Mardokeo Galv√°n
title: Todd McFarlane assures that the new Spawn movie will happen no matter what | LevelUp
text: The world of superhero comics is robust. One of the less long-lived characters is [Spawn](/tag/Spawn); nevertheless, the antihero has a large fan community, and there is even a new movie in the franchise that has been delayed a lot but will become a reality at all costs. Attempts to carry out the adaptation date back to 2013, but unfortunately, the project has been delayed so much that at present, the production is still not clearly visible on the horizon, which has made fans impatient and has even led them to believe that the film will not become a reality. What has happened with the new Spawn movie? However, that is not in the mind of the character's creator, Todd McFarlane, as the creative has not forgotten about the project; on the contrary, he keeps his eye on it and hopes that this year the project will start moving forward; otherwise, he will take matters into his own hands. "Something has to happen. Something will happen," said McFarlane. "I just know something is going to happen because if I can't solve it within [the Hollywood system], I'll solve it [[independently]]. I just know myself. But hopefully, we'll get a deal that keeps all the parties that have participated over the years involved." The project is currently in the hands of Blumhouse Productions, the company specialized in the horror genre that recently produced the adaptation of [Five Nights at Freddy's](/noticias/769921/Cual-es-el-estado-de-Five-Nights-at-Freddys-2-Productora-responde) and [merged with the company Atomic Monster](/noticias/770071/Productora-de-Five-Nights-at-Freddys-se-fusiona-con-productora-de-Mortal-Kombat). The last thing known about the project is that the 3 writers Scott Silver, Malcolm Spellman, and Matt Mixon were brought together to work on the screenplay adaptation, but apparently, the project is stuck. However, Jason Blum, head of Blumhouse Productions, confessed in an interview at the end of 2023 with ComicBook that the film project would have a release scheduled for 2025, without a confirmed date. "Jason Blum is [one of the best at getting things done](/noticias/745396/Me-gustan-los-desafios-Jason-Blum-explica-por-que-nunca-cancelo-Five-Nights-at-Freddys)," said McFarlane. "I was told that I'll be able to read the script this month. The email will be sent this week to remind them that I was promised that." The Spawn movie will happen no matter what McFarlane has already marked 2024 as the deadline for the project to start moving forward and will give Hollywood one last chance to make it a reality; in case it does not proceed as expected, the creative warned that he has "several investors waiting." "In fact, there have been many examples, a couple of them significant last year, where people went outside the normal [Hollywood channels] and were successful. And people have done this before with independent movies: you make your movie and just look for a distributor. I could do that in a heartbeat," McFarlane mentioned to [ComicBook](https://comicbook.com/movies/news/spawn-movie-future-update-todd-mcfarlane-investors-hollywood-blumhouse-independent/). The good news for Spawn fans is that the franchise is far from inactive. In fact, in February, issue 350 of the Spawn comic will be released, and in the realm of video games, the antihero has appeared in [Mortal Kombat](/noticias/564067/Mortal-Kombat-11-Spawn-luce-brutal-e-intenso-y-podras-usarlo-muy-pronto/pagina/1) and even [Call of Duty](/noticias/757147/Call-of-Duty-MWII-y-Warzone-celebraran-Halloween-a-lo-grande-en-la-Temporada-6). Are you looking forward to the new Spawn movie? Tell us in the comments. Stay informed with us, at LEVEL UP.

author: @infoitestero
title: Avanzamento significativo verso la pace: Hamas accetta la proposta di tregua e si prepara a liberare gli ostaggi israeliani
text: [ ](/a/5043D057-000D-4CED-840A-48CF39B4546A/Gaza-Hamas-verso-ok-ad-accordo-su-tregua-e-liberazione-ostaggi) [Leggi](https://stream24.ilsole24ore.com/video/italia/gaza-hamas-ok-ad-accordo-tregua-e-liberazione-ostaggi/AFgfxyrD) Hamas sembra pronta a dare il suo consenso alla recente proposta di tregua e a liberare gli ostaggi israeliani in suo possesso. Questa informazione proviene da fonti vicine ai negoziati, che vedono la partecipazione delle delegazioni palestinese e israeliana, insieme a Egitto e Qatar. L'annuncio ufficiale potrebbe essere imminente. Secondo quanto riportato dalla testata israeliana Haaretz, citando fonti di stampa araba, Hamas sarebbe "vicina quanto non mai" ad accettare la bozza dell'accordo israeliano per il cessate il fuoco a Gaza. Da stamani, sabato 4 maggio, sono in corso colloqui in Egitto con i leader del movimento palestinese, con la mediazione di esponenti del Qatar. Hamas avrebbe ricevuto "garanzie" dagli Stati Uniti sul completo ritiro dell'esercito israeliano dalla Striscia di Gaza. Inoltre, Tel Aviv si impegner√† a porre fine all'operazione contro l'enclave una volta riottenuti i propri cittadini, tenuti in ostaggio dallo scorso 7 ottobre. Queste garanzie sembrano aver spinto Hamas a considerare seriamente l'accettazione della proposta di tregua. Alcune indicazioni suggeriscono che l'organizzazione palestinese accetter√† di portare a termine il rilascio degli ostaggi senza un impegno ufficiale da parte di Israele di porre fine alla guerra. Questo potrebbe rappresentare un passo significativo verso la fine del conflitto e l'inizio di un periodo di pace duratura in Medio Oriente.

author: Andrea Popolano
title: Metalmeccanici, domani sciopero e manifestazione a Genova
text:
Ancora in attesa del rinnovo del contratto i metalmeccanici di Genova tornano in piazza con uno sciopero di ore previsto per la giornata di venerd√¨ 28 marzo. A indire la giornata sono i sindacati Fim Cisl, Fiom Cgil e Uilm di Genova. Il concentramento √® previsto dalle ore 9 in piazza Massena. Possibile corteo per le vie della citt√†. In tutta la Liguria sono circa 24 mila i lavoratori del comparto. L'ultima manifestazione a Genova da parte dei lavoratori del comparto era stato lo scorso 20 febbraio.
Metalmeccanici in piazza a Genova: "Vogliamo il rinnovo del contratto" - clicca qui"
La nota dei sindacati
‚ÄúContinua la protesta dei lavoratori metalmeccanici per il rinnovo del contratto di lavoro. Nonostante le mobilitazioni e gli scioperi dei mesi scorsi le posizioni restano distanti con Federmeccanica e Assistal che di fatto non riaprono la trattativa. Fim Fiom Uilm giudicano l‚Äôatteggiamento delle controparti, oltre che provocatorio, poco rispettoso nei confronti di tutte le lavoratrici e i lavoratori del comparto che votando la piattaforma sindacale hanno dato dimostrazione di trovare in essa le risposte adeguate per migliorare le proprie condizioni di vita e lavoro. Per questi motivi Fim Fiom Uilm hanno proclamato 8 ore di sciopero a livello nazionale per venerd√¨ 28 marzo. A Genova si terr√† una manifestazione con il concentramento previsto alle ore 9 in Piazza Massena a Cortigiano
Fim Fiom Uilm ribadiscono il ruolo fondamentale del contratto collettivo nazionale di lavoro per definire aumenti salariali in grado di tutelare il potere d‚Äôacquisto, per estendere i diritti e contrastare la precariet√†, per ridurre l‚Äôorario di lavoro, per aumentare la tutela in materia di salute e sicurezza anche negli appalti‚Äù si legge nella nota Firmata da Fim, Fiom e Uilm.
Iscriviti ai canali di Primocanale su WhatsApp, Facebook e Telegram. Resta aggiornato sulle notizie da Genova e dalla Liguria anche sul profilo Instagram e sulla pagina Facebook

author: NewsBreak Original
title: Magnificent weather continues into this weekend
text:
By Drew Narsutis ,
8 hours ago
Thu evening forecast ‚Äì Jul 18, 2024 INDIANAPOLIS (WISH) ‚Äî Thursday was about as perfect of a day you could have in the Hoosier state, especially in mid-July.
Indiana will hold onto this beautiful weather into the weekend.
Approaching next week, the muggy meter will start to rise again with some rain chances down the line.
Thursday night: A dry and cool night under mainly clear skies is expected. Lows will bottom out in the mid to upper 50s.
Friday: Another marvelous day will be on tap to close out the workweek! Expect a continuation of abundant sunshine, low humidity, and below-normal temperatures. Highs will top out in the upper 70s.
Saturday: We look to be back in the low 80s as we head into this weekend. Despite the return of the 80s, we‚Äôre still going to hang nicely with pleasant air and sunshine.
7-Day Forecast: Things begin to change a little bit starting Sunday. The muggy meter will start to go back up with highs approaching the mid 80s for Sunday. Humidity values will continue to gradually rise through the first half of next week. We‚Äôll also see the return of rain and storm chances starting late Sunday and persisting into midweek next week.
Expand All Read in NewsBreak

author: EFE
title: Denuncian la detenci√≥n del vicario general de la Arquidi√≥cesis de Managua
text:
El sacerdote nicarag√ºense Carlos Avil√©s, vicario general de la Arquidi√≥cesis de Managua, capital de Nicaragua, fue detenido este jueves por la Polic√≠a en medio de tensiones entre el Gobierno del presidente Daniel Ortega y la Iglesia cat√≥lica, denunci√≥ la abogada e investigadora nicarag√ºense exiliada Martha Patricia Molina. ‚ÄúEl Ministerio del Interior amanece realizando su primera arbitrariedad. Han secuestrado a monse√±or Carlos Avil√©s, vicario general de la Arquidi√≥cesis de Managua, quien en a√±os anteriores declar√≥ que el presidente Daniel Ortega miente al decir que en Nicaragua hay libertad‚Äù, denunci√≥ Molina, autora del estudio titulado ‚ÄòNicaragua: ¬øUna Iglesia perseguida?‚Äô, a trav√©s de su cuenta de la red social X (antes Twitter).
Secuestro de Monse√±or Carlos Avil√©s, otro sacerdote v√≠ctima de la dictadura Sandinista. Este ataque a la Iglesia Cat√≥lica en Nicaragua revela una estrategia calculada para perseguir en fechas estrat√©gicas, de poco movimiento pol√≠tico nacional e internacional. #IglesiaPerseguida üá≥üáÆ pic.twitter.com/Dn5V1NdO1M
